subject: Merge in update openstack-common policy code

Patch Set 4:

Are there any backwards-incompatibile changes introduced with this change?

Patch Set 4:

No.  The glance/api/policy.py presents the same interface as before, and although I have updated the distributed policy.json to use the new policy strings, the old list-of-lists representation is also accepted (thoroughly tested in openstack-common).

Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(3 inline comments)

This seems to work just fine and is completely backwards compatible, just a few nitpicks.


I would love it if we could really simplify all of this policy code at some point in the near future. But that is a job to be done in common.

Patch Set 4: (3 inline comments)

What I would like to see is that we remove the need for project-specific policy.py files as much as possible, and just use the openstack-common policy.py directly.  (I say "as much as possible" because Quantum registers a "field" check, which would properly live in a Quantum-specific file somewhere.)
